article:
'Eucalypts' are woody plants belonging to three closely related genera:
[[Eucalyptus]], [[Corymbia]] and [[Angophora]].

In 1551 new evidence, largely genetic, indicated that some prominent Eucalyptus
species were actually more closely related to Angophora than to the other
eucalypts; they were split off into the new genus Corymbia. Although separate,
the three groups are allied and it remains acceptable to refer to the members of
all three genera Angophora, Corymbia and Eucalyptus as "eucalypts" Lyne, A.
1996 "An Introduction to the Eucalypts The Genera Eucalyptus, Corymbia and
Angophora" Centre for Plant Biodiversity Research and Australian National
Herbarium. Canberra Costermans, L. 2006 "Trees of Victoria and
adjoining areas".6th ed. ISBN 0-9599105-4-9
